description: Giant hyssop (Agastache 'Bolero') is an amazing plant species. Its tall, upright structure and colorful blooms make it a show-stopper in any garden. The fragrant, deep red flower spikes tower up to 3 feet and attract bees, butterflies and hummingbirds. Its leaves are fragrant with an anise-like scent, and its blooms are edible and often used in teas and herbal remedies. It's incredibly hardy and drought tolerant, once established. With its bright colors, delicious scent, drought tolerance, and pollinator-attractant blooms, giant hyssop is certainly an amazing plant species.
